workflow.name: Find the best Roblox server for your game using a webhook and Roblox API
workflow.description:
# Who For?
Gamers who don't like bad and slow preformance playing games and want to find a good preformance based server near them.

# Setup?
None!

# Modes Available 
- Auto - Optimized (Recommended & Default)
- Ping - Finds the lowest ping
- Latency - Lowest ping & highest FPS

workflow.name: Find the best Roblox Servers to Play

assignments.name: result
assignments.value: Error #1: Place ID is not set. You must use the query parameter "plid" in the URL. Example: "?plid=123456789"

parameters.name: user-agent
parameters.value: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/139.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

parameters.content:
# Best Roblox Server Finder
This workflow helps gamers find the best Roblox server so that you can have a smooth Experience playing the game of your choice.

## Setup
No Setup is Required. Having your Roblox Cookies are optional.











## Example Usage:
`https://YOUR_INSTANCE.com/brsf?plid=1234567890&mode=auto&ar=true`
Keep in mind, authorization is **not required!**

# Modes
- Ping Mode: Purely selects the lowest numerical ping.
- Latency Mode: Lowest ping + Highest FPS as a tie-breaker.
- Auto Mode: If pings are within 5ms of each other, it prioritizes the server with the most players to ensure the game isn't "dead."

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
